poem:
"A Change Speaks"

Old nectar, now reborn anew,
Under a name less stained with rue.
Plantation to Planteray does shift,
In response to the social rift.

Yet in each drop, a history lies,
Of bondage, blood and sorrowful sighs.
A label changed, so slick and neat,
Can it amend a past so bittersweet?
